channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: LLaMA-Omni: Seamless Speech Interaction with Large Language Models
item.description: We build our model based on the latest Llama-3. 1-8B-Instruct model.

item.title: PuLID: Pure and Lightning ID Customization via Contrastive Alignment
item.description: We propose Pure and Lightning ID customization (PuLID), a novel tuning-free ID customization method for text-to-image generation.

item.title: PaperQA: Retrieval-Augmented Generative Agent for Scientific Research
item.description: We present PaperQA, a RAG agent for answering questions over the scientific literature.

item.title: Windows Agent Arena: Evaluating Multi-Modal OS Agents at Scale
item.description: To demonstrate Windows Agent Arena's capabilities, we also introduce a new multi-modal agent, Navi.

item.title: optillm
item.description: Optimizing inference proxy for LLMs

item.title: Mini-Omni: Language Models Can Hear, Talk While Thinking in Streaming
item.description: We also introduce the VoiceAssistant-400K dataset to fine-tune models optimized for speech output.

item.title: Agent Workflow Memory
item.description: Despite the potential of language model-based agents to solve real-world tasks such as web navigation, current methods still struggle with long-horizon tasks with complex action trajectories.

item.title: Hi3D: Pursuing High-Resolution Image-to-3D Generation with Video Diffusion Models
item.description: Despite having tremendous progress in image-to-3D generation, existing methods still struggle to produce multi-view consistent images with high-resolution textures in detail, especially in the paradigm of 2D diffusion that lacks 3D awareness.

item.title: "Do Anything Now": Characterizing and Evaluating In-The-Wild Jailbreak Prompts on Large Language Models
item.description: We hope that our study can facilitate the research community and LLM vendors in promoting safer and regulated LLMs.

item.title: Super Monotonic Alignment Search
item.description: Monotonic alignment search (MAS), introduced by Glow-TTS, is one of the most popular algorithm in TTS to estimate unknown alignments between text and speech.

item.title: FlashSplat: 2D to 3D Gaussian Splatting Segmentation Solved Optimally
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate the efficiency and robustness of our method in segmenting various scenes, and its superior performance in downstream tasks such as object removal and inpainting.

item.title: iText2KG: Incremental Knowledge Graphs Construction Using Large Language Models
item.description: Our method demonstrates superior performance compared to baseline methods across three scenarios: converting scientific papers to graphs, websites to graphs, and CVs to graphs.

item.title: NeuFlow v2: High-Efficiency Optical Flow Estimation on Edge Devices
item.description: In this paper, we propose a highly efficient optical flow method that balances high accuracy with reduced computational demands.

item.title: MemoRAG: Moving towards Next-Gen RAG Via Memory-Inspired Knowledge Discovery
item.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) leverages retrieval tools to access external databases, thereby enhancing the generation quality of large language models (LLMs) through optimized context.

item.title: OneGen: Efficient One-Pass Unified Generation and Retrieval for LLMs
item.description: This paper introduces a novel and efficient One-pass Generation and retrieval framework (OneGen), designed to improve LLMs' performance on tasks that require both generation and retrieval.

item.title: AWQ: Activation-aware Weight Quantization for LLM Compression and Acceleration
item.description: We propose Activation-aware Weight Quantization (AWQ), a hardware-friendly approach for LLM low-bit weight-only quantization.

item.title: Dynamic Gaussian Marbles for Novel View Synthesis of Casual Monocular Videos
item.description: We evaluate on the Nvidia Dynamic Scenes dataset and the DyCheck iPhone dataset, and show that Gaussian Marbles significantly outperforms other Gaussian baselines in quality, and is on-par with non-Gaussian representations, all while maintaining the efficiency, compositionality, editability, and tracking benefits of Gaussians.

item.title: Quiet-STaR: Language Models Can Teach Themselves to Think Before Speaking
item.description: Crucially, these improvements require no fine-tuning on these tasks.

item.title: RealisDance: Equip controllable character animation with realistic hands
item.description: 2) The hands generated using the DWPose sequence are blurry and unrealistic.

item.title: gsplat: An Open-Source Library for Gaussian Splatting
item.description: gsplat is an open-source library designed for training and developing Gaussian Splatting methods.
